medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe Dunnigan-Type Familial Partial Lipodystrophy Type 2.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first sister presented with acanthosis nigricans at age 5, followed by diabetes with insulin resistance, hypertension, and hypertriglyceridemia at age 13, and partial lipodystrophy starting at puberty. The second sister was assessed at age 26; she was diagnosed with T2DM, hypertriglyceridemia, and hypertension at age 17. Both sisters showed aggravation of symptoms through hypertriglyceridemia leading to acute pancreatitis and hospitalization.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both sisters have a medical history of diabetes, hypertension, hypertriglyceridemia, acanthosis nigricans, and partial lipodystrophy. Proband 1 experienced depression since age 10 and acute pancreatitis at age 17. Proband 2 had bilateral sixth cranial nerve palsies and underwent subtotal pancreatectomy due to complications from pancreatitis.
medical_history.family_history: The mother had a similar metabolic profile and died of vascular disease at age 32. The maternal uncle had T2DM since age 60, and the maternal grandfather had long-standing hypertension. The father had hypertension, and several maternal and paternal relatives had diabetes.
